cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, expected to cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-northwest into the south-central Gulf and toward the north-central Gulf Coast (mainly Louisiana/Mississippi) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana shoreline

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the U.S. Gulf Coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the U.S. Gulf Coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coasts of eastern Yucatan, then northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas-Louisiana border eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (10-27%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Monday into Tuesday; gusty squalls possible if the track shifts westward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for Texas City based on current projected track; main surge threat east of the TX-LA border.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of showers with locally 1â€“2 inches possible Monday-Tuesday; widespread heavy rainfall is not expected unless the track shifts significantly west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine squalls and rough seas in the western Gulf early next week could affect vessel traffic.
